Class Animal

  • java.lang.Object
    • Animal

  • public class Animal
extends java.lang.Object
    This class instantiates a basic Animal object with a name, x/y coordinate values, and a max speed. It is used in the AnimalMain class.
    Since:
    1.0

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Animal()
      Default constructor which calls its parameterized constructor Passes String "unknown", int 0, int 0, int 4.
      Animal(java.lang.String initName, int initX, int initY, int initMaxSpd)
      Parameterized constructor.

      Set this animal's fighting status : true or false.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns Animal's name and [x, y] coordinates as a string.
      boolean touching(Animal other)
      Tests to see if this Animal and the passed Animal objects have x and y that are both equal to each other, returns true/false.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Animal

        public Animal()
        Default constructor which calls its parameterized constructor Passes String "unknown", int 0, int 0, int 4.

      • Animal

        public Animal(java.lang.String initName,
              int initX,
              int initY,
              int initMaxSpd)
        Parameterized constructor.
        Parameters:
        initName - the name of the animal.
        initX - the x coordinate, will be capped at DOMAIN values.
        initY - the y coordinate, will be capped at RANGE values
        initMaxSpd - the max movement value used when determining how much to randomly move, starting from 1 to this number, will be capped at MAX_SPD_RANGE values.
        See Also:
        DOMAIN, RANGE, MAX_SPD_RANGE, setX(int), setY(int), setMaxSpd(int)

    • Method Detail

      • move

        public void move()
        Moves this animal in a random direction a distance calculated from random 1 to maxspd.
        See Also:
        maxspd

      • touching

        public boolean touching(Animal other)
        Tests to see if this Animal and the passed Animal objects have x and y that are both equal to each other, returns true/false.
        Parameters:
        other - The seperate Animal object instance to test against.
        Returns:
        True if this.x == other.x and this.y == other.y; false otherwise.

      • setFighting

        public void setFighting(boolean status)
        Set this animal's fighting status : true or false.
        Parameters:
        status - The new fighting status passed true or false.
        See Also:
        isfighting

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns Animal's name and [x, y] coordinates as a string.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
